method.description: Returns :mini:`Value₂` if :mini:`Value₁` and :mini:`Value₂` are not exactly the same instance and :mini:`nil` otherwise.
Returns :mini:`Argₙ` if :mini:`Arg₁ != Argᵢ` for i = 2, ..., n and :mini:`nil` otherwise.
Returns a hash for :mini:`Value` for use in lookup tables, etc.

method.name: :append
method.description: Appends a representation of :mini:`Value` to :mini:`Buffer`.

method.name: :in
method.description: Returns :mini:`Value` if it is an instance of :mini:`Type` or a type that inherits from :mini:`Type` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.

method.name: :max
method.description: Returns :mini:`A` if :mini:`A > B` and :mini:`B` otherwise.

method.name: :min
method.description: Returns :mini:`A` if :mini:`A < B` and :mini:`B` otherwise.
Returns :mini:`Argₙ` if :mini:`Arg₁ < Arg₂ < ... < Argₙ` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.
Returns :mini:`Argₙ` if :mini:`Arg₁ <= Arg₂ <= ... <= Argₙ` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.

Compares :mini:`Value₁` and :mini:`Value₂` and returns :mini:`-1`, :mini:`0` or :mini:`1`. This comparison is based on the types and internal addresses of :mini:`Value₁` and :mini:`Value₂` and thus only has no persistent meaning.
Returns :mini:`Value₂` if :mini:`Value₁` and :mini:`Value₂` are exactly the same instance and :mini:`nil` otherwise.
Returns :mini:`Argₙ` if :mini:`Arg₁ = Arg₂ = ... = Argₙ` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.
Returns :mini:`Argₙ` if :mini:`Arg₁ > Arg₂ > ... > Argₙ` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.
Returns :mini:`Argₙ` if :mini:`Arg₁ >= Arg₂ >= ... >= Argₙ` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.
Returns an sequence that produces the values from :mini:`Sequence₁` followed by those from :mini:`Sequence₂`.
Returns an sequence that repeatedly produces the values from :mini:`Sequence` (for use with :mini:`limit`).
Returns a chained function equivalent to :mini:`Function(Base(...))`.
Returns a chained sequence equivalent to :mini:`(K₁, F(V₁)), ..., (Kₙ, F(Vₙ))` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Base`.
Returns a chained sequence equivalent to :mini:`(K₁, F ! V₁), ..., (Kₙ, F ! Vₙ)` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Base`.
Returns a chained sequence equivalent to :mini:`(Kⱼ, Vⱼ), ...` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Base` and :mini:`F ! Vⱼ` returns non-:mini:`nil`.
Returns a new sequence that generates the keys and values from :mini:`Function(Value)` for each value generated by :mini:`Sequence`.
Returns a chained sequence equivalent to :mini:`(Kⱼ, Vⱼ), ...` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Base` and :mini:`F(Vⱼ)` returns non-:mini:`nil`.
Returns a chained sequence equivalent to :mini:`(Kⱼ, Vⱼ), ...` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Base` while :mini:`F(Vⱼ)` returns non-:mini:`nil`.

Returns a sequence that produces :mini:`V₁`, :mini:`Fn(V₁, V₂)`, :mini:`Fn(Fn(V₁, V₂), V₃)`, ... .
.. deprecated:: 2.9.0
Use :mini:`distill` instead.

Returns a sequence that produces :mini:`Initial`, :mini:`Fn(Initial, V₁)`, :mini:`Fn(Fn(Initial, V₁), V₂)`, ... .
.. deprecated:: 2.9.0
Use :mini:`distill` instead.

method.name: :find
method.description: Returns the first key generated by :mini:`Sequence` with correspding value :mini:`= Value`.

method.name: :first
method.description: Returns the first value produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

method.name: :first2
method.description: Returns the first key and value produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

method.name: :join
method.description: Joins the elements of :mini:`Sequence` into a string using :mini:`Separator` between elements.

method.name: :join
method.description: Joins the elements of :mini:`Sequence` into a string.

method.name: :key
method.description: Returns the current key produced by :mini:`Iterator`.

method.name: :last
method.description: Returns the last value produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

method.name: :last2
method.description: Returns the last key and value produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

method.name: :limit
method.description: Returns an sequence that produces at most :mini:`Limit` values from :mini:`Sequence`.

method.name: :next
method.description: Advances :mini:`Iterator`, returning :mini:`nil` if it is finished.

method.name: :provided
method.description: Returns an sequence that stops when :mini:`Fn(Value)` is :mini:`nil`.

method.name: :random
method.description: Returns a random value produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

method.name: :repeat
method.description:
Returns a sequence that generates the result of calling :mini:`Function()` at each iteration until :mini:`nil` is returned.
.. deprecated:: 2.9.0
Use :mini:`^` instead.

method.name: :skip
method.description: Returns an sequence that skips the first :mini:`Skip` values from :mini:`Sequence` and then produces the rest.

method.name: :value
method.description: Returns the current value produced by :mini:`Iterator`.
Returns a chained sequence equivalent to :mini:`(K₁, F(K₁, V₁)), ..., (Kₙ, F(Kₙ, Vₙ))` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Base`.
Returns a chained sequence equivalent to :mini:`(F₁(K₁, V₁), F₂(K₁, V₁)), ..., (F₁(Kₙ, Vₙ), F₂(Kₙ, Vₙ))` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Base`.

example.code: map("cake" => (tuple, *)) :> {(1, c) is "c", (2, a) is "aa", (3, k) is "kkk", (4, e) is "eeee"}

method.description: Returns a new sequence that generates the keys and values from :mini:`Function(Key, Value)` for each key and value generated by :mini:`Sequence`.
Returns a chained sequence equivalent to :mini:`(Kⱼ, Vⱼ), ...` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Base` and :mini:`F(Kⱼ, Vⱼ)` returns non-:mini:`nil`.
Returns a chained sequence equivalent to :mini:`(Kⱼ, Vⱼ), ...` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Base` while :mini:`F(Kⱼ, Vⱼ)` returns non-:mini:`nil`.
Returns an infinite sequence that repeatedly produces :mini:`Value`. Should be used with :mini:`:limit` or paired with a finite sequence in :mini:`zip`, :mini:`weave`, etc.
Returns a sequence that produces :mini:`Initial`, :mini:`Fn(Initial)`, :mini:`Fn(Fn(Initial))`, ... stopping when :mini:`Fn(Last)` returns :mini:`nil`.

type.name: chained
type.description:
A chained function or sequence, consisting of a base function or sequence and any number of additional functions or filters.
When used as a function or sequence, the base is used to produce an initial result, then the additional functions are applied in turn to the result.
Filters do not affect the result but will shortcut a function call or skip an iteration if :mini:`nil` is returned. I.e. filters remove values from a sequence that fail a condition without affecting the values that pass.

type.name: sequence
type.description: The base type for any sequence value.

method.description:
Returns a new sequence that generates the keys and values from :mini:`Function(Value)` for each value generated by :mini:`Sequence`.
.. deprecated:: 2.5.0
Use :mini:`->>` instead.
Returns a sequence that generates the result of calling :mini:`Function()` at each iteration until :mini:`nil` is returned.

function.name: all
function.description: Returns :mini:`nil` if :mini:`nil` is produced by :mini:`Sequence`. Otherwise returns :mini:`some`. If :mini:`Sequence` is empty, then :mini:`some` is returned.

example.code: all([1, 2, 3, 4]) :> some all([1, 2, nil, 4]) :> nil all([]) :> some

function.name: batch
function.description: Returns a new sequence that calls :mini:`Function` with each batch of :mini:`Size` values produced by :mini:`Sequence` and produces the results. If a :mini:`Shift` is provided then :mini:`Size - Shift` values of each batch come from the previous batch.

constructor.name: chained
constructor.description: Returns a new chained function or sequence with base :mini:`Base` and additional functions or filters :mini:`Fn₁, ..., Fnₙ`.

example.code: let F := chained(fun(X) X + 1, fun(X) X ^ 2) F(10) :> 121

function.name: count
function.description: Returns the count of the values produced by :mini:`Sequence`. For some types of sequences (e.g. :mini:`list`, :mini:`map`, etc), the count is simply retrieved. For all other types, the sequence is iterated and the total number of values counted.

function.name: count2
function.description: Returns a map of the values produced by :mini:`Sequence` with associated counts.

function.name: distill
function.description: Returns a sequence that produces :mini:`Initial`, :mini:`Fn(Initial, V₁)`, :mini:`Fn(Fn(Initial, V₁), V₂)`, ... . If :mini:`Initial` is omitted, the first value produced by :mini:`Sequence` is used.

function.name: fold
function.description: Returns a new sequence that treats alternating values produced by :mini:`Sequence` as keys and values respectively.

function.name: grid
function.description: Returns a new sequence that produces :mini:`Function(V₁, V₂, ..., Vₙ)` for all possible combinations of :mini:`V₁, ..., Vₙ`, where :mini:`Vᵢ` are the values produced by :mini:`Sequenceᵢ`.

example.code: list(grid(1 .. 3, "cake", [true, false], tuple)) :> [(1, c, true), (1, c, false), (1, a, true), (1, a, false), (1, k, true), (1, k, false), (1, e, true), (1, e, false), (2, c, true), (2, c, false), (2, a, true), (2, a, false), (2, k, true), (2, k, false), (2, e, true), (2, e, false), (3, c, true), (3, c, false), (3, a, true), (3, a, false), (3, k, true), (3, k, false), (3, e, true), (3, e, false)] list(grid(1 .. 3, "cake", *)) :> ["c", "a", "k", "e", "cc", "aa", "kk", "ee", "ccc", "aaa", "kkk", "eee"]

function.name: iterate
function.description: Create an iterator for :mini:`Sequence`. Returns :mini:`nil` is :mini:`Sequence` is empty.

function.name: key
function.description: Returns a new sequence which produces the keys of :mini:`Sequence`.

function.name: max
function.description: Returns the largest value (using :mini:`:max`) produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

function.name: max2
function.description: Returns a tuple with the key and value of the largest value (using :mini:`>`) produced by :mini:`Sequence`. Returns :mini:`nil` if :mini:`Sequence` is empty.

function.name: min
function.description: Returns the smallest value (using :mini:`:min`) produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

function.name: min2
function.description: Returns a tuple with the key and value of the smallest value (using :mini:`<`) produced by :mini:`Sequence`. Returns :mini:`nil` if :mini:`Sequence` is empty.

function.name: pair
function.description: Returns a new sequence that produces the values from :mini:`Sequence₁` as keys and the values from :mini:`Sequence₂` as values.

function.name: prod
function.description: Returns the product of the values (using :mini:`*`) produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

function.name: reduce
function.description: Returns :mini:`Fn(Fn( ... Fn(Initial, V₁), V₂) ..., Vₙ)` where :mini:`Vᵢ` are the values produced by :mini:`Sequence`. If :mini:`Initial` is omitted, the first value produced by :mini:`Sequence` is used.

function.name: reduce2
function.description: Returns :mini:`Fn(Fn( ... Fn(Initial, K₁, V₁), K₂, V₂) ..., Kₙ, Vₙ)` where :mini:`Kᵢ` and :mini:`Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Sequence`. If :mini:`Initial` is omitted, a tuple with the first key and value produced by :mini:`Sequence` is used.

function.name: some
function.description: Returns the first value produced by :mini:`Sequence` that is not :mini:`nil`.

example.code: some([nil, nil, "X", nil]) :> "X" some([nil, nil, nil, nil]) :> nil

function.name: sum
function.description: Returns the sum of the values (using :mini:`+`) produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

function.name: swap
function.description: Returns a new sequence which swaps the keys and values produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

function.name: unfold
function.description: Returns a new sequence that treats produces alternatively the keys and values produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

function.name: unique
function.description: Returns an sequence that returns the unique values produced by :mini:`Sequence`. Uniqueness is determined by using a :mini:`map`.

function.name: unpack
function.description: Returns a new sequence unpacks each value generated by :mini:`Sequence` as keys and values respectively.

function.name: weave
function.description: Returns a new sequence that produces interleaved values :mini:`Vᵢ` from each of :mini:`Sequenceᵢ`. The sequence stops produces values when any of the :mini:`Sequenceᵢ` stops.

function.name: zip
function.description: Returns a new sequence that produces :mini:`Function(V₁₁, ..., Vₙ₁), Function(V₁₂, ..., Vₙ₂), ...` where :mini:`Vᵢⱼ` is the :mini:`j`-th value produced by :mini:`Sequenceᵢ`. The sequence stops produces values when any of the :mini:`Sequenceᵢ` stops.

function.name: zip2
function.description: Returns a new sequence that produces :mini:`KeyFn(K₁₁, ..., Kₙ₁) - ValueFn(V₁₁, ..., Vₙ₁), ...` where :mini:`Kᵢⱼ - Vᵢⱼ` are the :mini:`j`-th key and value produced by :mini:`Sequenceᵢ`. The sequence stops produces values when any of the :mini:`Sequenceᵢ` stops.

method.description: Calls :mini:`Function` with the values in :mini:`Tuple` as positional arguments.
Calls :mini:`Function` with the keys and values in :mini:`Map` as named arguments. Returns an error if any of the keys in :mini:`Map` is not a string or method.

Calls :mini:`Function` with the values in :mini:`Tuple` as positional arguments and the keys and values in :mini:`Map` as named arguments. Returns an error if any of the keys in :mini:`Map` is not a string or method.
Calls :mini:`Function` with the values in :mini:`List` as positional arguments.

Calls :mini:`Function` with the values in :mini:`List` as positional arguments and the keys and values in :mini:`Map` as named arguments. Returns an error if any of the keys in :mini:`Map` is not a string or method.

.. deprecated:: 2.7.0
Use :mini:`$!` instead.
Returns a function equivalent to :mini:`fun(Args...) Function(List[1], List[2], ..., Args...)`.
Returns a function equivalent to :mini:`fun(Args...) Function(Values..., Args...)`.
Returns a function equivalent to :mini:`fun(Args...) Function(List[1], List[2], ..., Args...)`.
Returns a function equivalent to :mini:`fun(Args...) Function()`.

type.name: function
type.description: The base type of all functions.

method.description: Returns the closest common parent type of :mini:`Type₁` and :mini:`Type₂`.
Returns the value of :mini:`Name` exported from :mini:`Type`. Returns an error if :mini:`Name` is not present. This allows types to behave as modules.

method.name: :append
method.description: Appends a representation of :mini:`Value` to :mini:`Buffer`.

method.name: :constructor
method.description: Returns the constructor for :mini:`Type`.

method.name: :exports
method.description: Returns a map of all the exports from :mini:`Type`.

method.name: :parents
method.description: Returns a list of the parent types of :mini:`Type`.

method.name: :rank
method.description: Returns the rank of :mini:`Type`, i.e. the depth of its inheritence tree.
Returns :mini:`Type₂` if :mini:`Type₂` is a strict parent of :mini:`Type₁`, otherwise returns :mini:`nil`.
Returns :mini:`Type₂` if :mini:`Type₂` is a parent of :mini:`Type₁`, otherwise returns :mini:`nil`.
Returns :mini:`Type₂` if :mini:`Type₂` is a strict sub-type of :mini:`Type₁`, otherwise returns :mini:`nil`.
Returns :mini:`Type₂` if :mini:`Type₂` is a sub-type of :mini:`Type₁`, otherwise returns :mini:`nil`.
Returns a union interface of :mini:`Type` and :mini:`type(nil)`.

type.name: type
type.description: Type of all types. Every type contains a set of named exports, which allows them to be used as modules.

method.description: Returns the generic type :mini:`Base[Type₁, ..., Typeₙ]`.

constructor.name: type
constructor.description: Returns the type of :mini:`Value`.

method.description: Returns a union interface of :mini:`Type₁` and :mini:`Type₂`.

method.name: :const
method.description: Default visitor implementation, just returns :mini:`Value`.

method.name: :copy
method.description: Default visitor implementation, just returns :mini:`Value`.

method.name: :visit
method.description: Default visitor implementation, just returns :mini:`nil`.

type.name: visitor
type.description:
Used to apply a transformation recursively to values.
:mini:`fun (V: visitor)(Value: any, Result: any): any` Adds the pair :mini:`(Value, Result)` to :mini:`V`'s cache and returns :mini:`Result`.
:mini:`fun (V: visitor)(Value: any): any` Visits :mini:`Value` with :mini:`V` returning the result.

function.name: assign
function.description: Functional equivalent of :mini:`Var := Value`.

function.name: call
function.description: Returns :mini:`Fn(Arg₁, ..., Argₙ)`.

function.name: cas
function.description: If the value of :mini:`Var` is *identically* equal to :mini:`Old`, then sets :mini:`Var` to :mini:`New` and returns :mini:`New`. Otherwise leaves :mini:`Var` unchanged and returns :mini:`nil`.

function.name: copy
function.description: Returns a copy of :mini:`Value` using a new :mini:`copy` instance which applies :mini:`Fn(Copy, Value)` to each value. If omitted, :mini:`Fn` defaults to :mini:`:copy`.

function.name: deref
function.description: Returns the dereferenced value of :mini:`Value`.

function.name: exchange
function.description: Assigns :mini:`Varᵢ := Varᵢ₊₁` for each :mini:`1 <= i < n` and :mini:`Varₙ := Var₁`.

function.name: findall
function.description: Returns a list of all unique values referenced by :mini:`Value` (including :mini:`Value`).

function.name: halt
function.description: Causes the current process to exit with optional exit code :mini:`Code` or :mini:`0` if omitted.

function.name: isconstant
function.description: Returns :mini:`some` if it is a constant (i.e. directly immutable and not referencing any mutable values), otherwise returns :mini:`nil`.

example.code: isconstant(1) :> 1 isconstant(1.5) :> 1.5 isconstant("Hello") :> "Hello" isconstant(true) :> true isconstant([1, 2, 3]) :> nil isconstant((1, 2, 3)) :> (1, 2, 3) isconstant((1, [2], 3)) :> nil

function.name: print
function.description: Prints :mini:`Values` to standard output, converting to strings if necessary.

function.name: replace
function.description: Assigns :mini:`Varᵢ := Varᵢ₊₁` for each :mini:`1 <= i < n` and :mini:`Varₙ := Value`. Returns the old value of :mini:`Var₁`.

function.name: visit
function.description: Returns :mini:`Fn(V, Value)` where :mini:`V` is a newly created :mini:`visitor`.

method.description: Returns :mini:`B` if :mini:`A:size != B:size` or :mini:`Aᵢ != Bᵢ` for some :mini:`i`.

method.name: :append
method.description: Appends a representation of :mini:`Value` to :mini:`Buffer`.

method.name: :const
method.description: Returns a new tuple containing copies of the elements of :mini:`Tuple` created using :mini:`Copy`.

method.name: :copy
method.description: Returns a new tuple containing copies of the elements of :mini:`Tuple` created using :mini:`Copy`.

method.name: :size
method.description: Returns the number of elements in :mini:`Tuple`.
Returns :mini:`B` if :mini:`Aᵢ = Bᵢ` for each :mini:`i = 1 .. j-1` and :mini:`Aⱼ < Bⱼ`.
Returns :mini:`B` if :mini:`Aᵢ = Bᵢ` for each :mini:`i = 1 .. j-1` and :mini:`Aⱼ <= Bⱼ`.
Returns :mini:`-1`, :mini:`0` or :mini:`1` depending on whether :mini:`Tuple₁` is less than, equal to or greater than :mini:`Tuple₂` using lexicographical ordering.
Returns :mini:`B` if :mini:`A:size = B:size` and :mini:`Aᵢ = Bᵢ` for each :mini:`i`.
Returns :mini:`B` if :mini:`Aᵢ = Bᵢ` for each :mini:`i = 1 .. j-1` and :mini:`Aⱼ > Bⱼ`.
Returns :mini:`B` if :mini:`Aᵢ = Bᵢ` for each :mini:`i = 1 .. j-1` and :mini:`Aⱼ >= Bⱼ`.

type.name: tuple
type.description:
An immutable tuple of values.
:mini:`(Tuple: tuple)(Arg₁, ..., Argₙ)` Returns :mini:`(Tuple[1](Arg₁, ..., Argₙ), ..., Tuple[k](Arg₁, ..., Argₙ))`

method.description: Returns the :mini:`Index`-th element in :mini:`Tuple` or an error if :mini:`Index` is out of range. Indexing starts at :mini:`1`. Negative indices count from the end, with :mini:`-1` returning the last element.

constructor.name: tuple
constructor.description: Returns a tuple of values :mini:`Value₁, ..., Valueₙ`.

method.description: Returns :mini:`Arg₂` if :mini:`Arg₁ != Arg₂` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.

example.code: true != true :> nil true != false :> false false != true :> true false != false :> nil

method.description: Returns the logical inverse of :mini:`Bool`
Returns the logical and of :mini:`Bool₁` and :mini:`Bool₂`.

example.code: true /\ true :> true true /\ false :> false false /\ true :> false false /\ false :> false

method.name: :append
method.description: Appends :mini:`"true"` or :mini:`"false"` to :mini:`Buffer`.
Returns :mini:`Arg₂` if :mini:`Arg₁ < Arg₂` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.

example.code: true < true :> nil true < false :> nil false < true :> true false < false :> nil

method.description: Returns :mini:`Arg₂` if :mini:`Arg₁ <= Arg₂` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.

example.code: true <= true :> true true <= false :> nil false <= true :> true false <= false :> false

method.description: Returns :mini:`-1`, :mini:`0` or :mini:`1` depending on whether :mini:`Bool₁` is less than, equal to or greater than :mini:`Bool₂`. :mini:`true` is considered greater than :mini:`false`.
Returns :mini:`Arg₂` if :mini:`Arg₁ == Arg₂` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.

example.code: true = true :> true true = false :> nil false = true :> nil false = false :> false

method.description: Returns :mini:`Arg₂` if :mini:`Arg₁ > Arg₂` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.

example.code: true > true :> nil true > false :> false false > true :> nil false > false :> nil

method.description: Returns the logical xor of :mini:`Bool₁` and :mini:`Bool₂`.

example.code: true >< true :> false true >< false :> true false >< true :> true false >< false :> false

method.description: Returns :mini:`Arg₂` if :mini:`Arg₁ >= Arg₂` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.

example.code: true >= true :> true true >= false :> false false >= true :> nil false >= false :> false

method.description: Returns the logical or of :mini:`Bool₁` and :mini:`Bool₂`.

example.code: true \/ true :> true true \/ false :> true false \/ true :> true false \/ false :> false

constructor.name: boolean
constructor.description: Returns :mini:`true` if :mini:`String` equals :mini:`"true"` (ignoring case). Returns :mini:`false` if :mini:`String` equals :mini:`"false"` (ignoring case). Otherwise returns an error.

function.name: boolean::random
function.description: Returns a random boolean that has probability :mini:`P` of being :mini:`true`. If omitted, :mini:`P` defaults to :mini:`0.5`.

method.description: Imports a symbol from a module.

method.name: :append
method.description: Appends a representation of :mini:`Value` to :mini:`Buffer`.

type.name: external
type.description: A placeholder value that can be encoded and replaced on decoding.

function.name: collect
function.description: Call garbage collector.

function.name: size
function.description: Returns information about the blocks of memory referenced by :mini:`Value`.

function.name: trace
function.description: Returns information about the blocks of memory referenced by :mini:`Value`.

method.description: Returns a sequence of the children of :mini:`Xml`.
Returns a sequence of the children of :mini:`Xml` for which :mini:`Fn(Child)` is non-nil.
Returns a sequence of the children of :mini:`Xml` with tag :mini:`Tag`.
Generates the sequence :mini:`Nodeᵢ / Args` where :mini:`Nodeᵢ` are the nodes generated by :mini:`Sequence`.
Returns a sequence of the children of :mini:`Xml` with :mini:`Attribute₁ = Value₁`, etc.
Returns a sequence of the children of :mini:`Xml` with tag :mini:`Tag` and :mini:`Attribute₁ = Value₁`, etc.
Returns a sequence of the recursive children of :mini:`Xml`, including :mini:`Xml`.
Returns a sequence of the recursive children of :mini:`Xml` with :mini:`Attribute₁ = Value₁`, etc.
Returns a sequence of the recursive children of :mini:`Xml` with tag :mini:`Tag` and :mini:`Attribute₁ = Value₁`, etc.
Returns a sequence of the recursive children of :mini:`Xml` for which :mini:`Fn(Child)` is non-nil.
Returns a sequence of the recursive children of :mini:`Xml` with tag :mini:`Tag`.
Generates the sequence :mini:`Nodeᵢ // Args` where :mini:`Nodeᵢ` are the nodes generated by :mini:`Sequence`.
Returns the value of the :mini:`Attribute` attribute of :mini:`Parent`.

method.name: :add_next
method.description: Inserts :mini:`Other` directly after :mini:`Node`.

method.name: :add_prev
method.description: Inserts :mini:`Other` directly before :mini:`Node`.

method.name: :append
method.description: Appends a string representation of :mini:`Xml` to :mini:`Buffer`.

method.name: :attributes
method.description: Returns the attributes of :mini:`Xml`.

method.name: :contains
method.description: Equivalent to :mini:`Sequence ->? fun(X) X:text:find(String)`.

method.name: :contains
method.description: Equivalent to :mini:`Sequence ->? fun(X) X:text:find(Regex)`.

method.name: :empty
method.description: Removes the contents of :mini:`Parent`.

method.name: :grow
method.description: Adds each node generated by :mini:`Children` to :mini:`Parent` and returns :mini:`Parent`.

method.name: :has
method.description: Equivalent to :mini:`Sequence ->? fun(X) some(Fn(X))`.

method.name: :index
method.description: Returns the index of :mini:`Node` in its parent or :mini:`nil`.

method.name: :next
method.description: Returns the next sibling of :mini:`Xml` or :mini:`nil`.

method.name: :next
method.description: Returns the :mini:`N`-th next sibling of :mini:`Xml` or :mini:`nil`.

method.name: :next

constructor.name: xml::element
constructor.description:
Returns a new XML node with tag :mini:`Tag` and optional children and attributes depending on the types of each :mini:`Argᵢ`:
* :mini:`string`: added as child text node. Consecutive strings are added a single node. * :mini:`xml`: added as a child node. * :mini:`list`: each value must be a :mini:`string` or :mini:`xml` and is added as above. * :mini:`map`: keys and values must be strings, set as attributes. * :mini:`name is value`: values must be strings, set as attributes.

method.name: :error
method.description: Completes :mini:`Task` with an :mini:`error(Type, Message)`, resuming any waiting code. Raises an error if :mini:`Task` is already complete.

type.name: task
type.description: A task representing a value that will eventually be completed.

type.name: tasks
type.description: A dynamic set of tasks (function calls). Multiple tasks can run in parallel (depending on the availability of a scheduler and/or asynchronous function calls).

function.name: buffered
function.description: Returns the sequence :mini:`(Kᵢ, Fn(Kᵢ, Vᵢ))` where :mini:`Kᵢ, Vᵢ` are the keys and values produced by :mini:`Sequence`. The calls to :mini:`Fn` are done in parallel, with at most :mini:`Size` calls at a time. The original sequence order is preserved (using an internal buffer).

function.name: parallel
function.description: Iterates through :mini:`Sequence` and calls :mini:`Fn(Key, Value)` for each :mini:`Key, Value` pair produced **without** waiting for the call to return. The call to :mini:`parallel` returns when all calls to :mini:`Fn` return, or an error occurs. If :mini:`Max` is given, at most :mini:`Max` calls to :mini:`Fn` will run at a time by pausing iteration through :mini:`Sequence`. If :mini:`Min` is also given then iteration will be resumed only when the number of calls to :mini:`Fn` drops to :mini:`Min`.

constructor.name: task
constructor.description: Returns a task. The task should eventually be completed with :mini:`Task:done()` or :mini:`Task:error()`.

constructor.name: task
constructor.description: Returns a task which calls :mini:`Fn(Arg₁, ..., Argₙ)`.

constructor.name: tasks
constructor.description:
Creates a new :mini:`tasks` set which will run at most :mini:`MaxRunning` child tasks in parallel.
At most :mini:`MaxPending` child tasks will be queued. Calls to add child tasks will wait until there some tasks are cleared.

constructor.name: tasks
constructor.description: Creates a new :mini:`tasks` set which will run at most :mini:`MaxRunning` child tasks in parallel.

constructor.name: tasks
constructor.description: Creates a new :mini:`tasks` set with no limits.

category.name: string
category.description:
Strings in Minilang can contain any sequence of bytes, including :mini:`0` bytes. Index and find methods however work on ``UTF-8`` characters, byte sequences that are not valid ``UTF-8`` are handled gracefully but the results are probably not very useful.
Every :mini:`string` is also an :mini:`address` so address methods can also be used to work at the byte level if necessary.
Indexing a string starts at :mini:`1`, with the last character at :mini:`String:length`. Negative indices are counted form the end, :mini:`-1` is the last character and :mini:`-String:length` is the first character.
When creating a substring, the first index is inclusive and second index is exclusive. The index :mini:`0` refers to just beyond the last character and can be used to take a substring to the end of a string.

method.name: :code
method.description: Returns the unicode codepoint of the first UTF-8 character of :mini:`String`.

method.name: :contains
method.description: Returns the :mini:`Haystack` if it contains :mini:`Pattern` or :mini:`nil` otherwise.

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":contains("cat") :> "The cat snored as he slept" "The cat snored as he slept":contains("dog") :> nil

method.name: :contains
method.description: Returns the :mini:`Haystack` if it contains :mini:`Pattern` or :mini:`nil` otherwise.

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":contains(r"[a-z]{3}") :> "The cat snored as he slept" "The cat snored as he slept":contains(r"[0-9]+") :> nil

method.name: :count
method.description: Returns the number of UTF-8 characters in :mini:`String`. Use :mini:`:size` to get the number of bytes.

method.name: :ctype
method.description: Returns the unicode type of the first character of :mini:`String`.

example.code: map("To €2 á\n" => (2, 2 -> :ctype)) :> {"T" is Lu, "o" is Ll, " " is Zs, "€" is Sc, "2" is Nd, "á" is Ll, "\n" is Cc}

method.description: Returns :mini:`String` if it ends with :mini:`Suffix` and :mini:`nil` otherwise.

method.description: Returns :mini:`String` with white space, quotes and backslashes replaced by escape sequences.

method.name: :find
method.description: Returns the index of the first occurence of :mini:`Needle` in :mini:`Haystack`, or :mini:`nil` if no occurence is found.

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":find("cat") :> 5 "The cat snored as he slept":find("dog") :> nil

method.name: :find
method.description: Returns the index of the first occurence of :mini:`Needle` in :mini:`Haystack` at or after :mini:`Start`, or :mini:`nil` if no occurence is found.

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":find("s", 1) :> 9 "The cat snored as he slept":find("s", 10) :> 17 "The cat snored as he slept":find("s", -6) :> 22

method.name: :find
method.description: Returns the index of the first occurence of :mini:`Pattern` in :mini:`Haystack`, or :mini:`nil` if no occurence is found.

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":find(r"[a-z]{3}") :> 5 "The cat snored as he slept":find(r"[0-9]+") :> nil

method.name: :find
method.description: Returns the index of the first occurence of :mini:`Pattern` in :mini:`Haystack` at or after :mini:`Start`, or :mini:`nil` if no occurence is found.

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":find(r"s[a-z]+", 1) :> 9 "The cat snored as he slept":find(r"s[a-z]+", 10) :> 22 "The cat snored as he slept":find(r"s[a-z]+", -6) :> 22

method.name: :find2
method.description: Returns :mini:`(Index, Match)` where :mini:`Index` is the first occurence of :mini:`Pattern` in :mini:`Haystack` at or after :mini:`Start`, or :mini:`nil` if no occurence is found.

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":find2(r"s[a-z]+", 1) :> (9, snored) "The cat snored as he slept":find2(r"s[a-z]+", 10) :> (22, slept) "The cat snored as he slept":find2(r"s[a-z]+", -6) :> (22, slept)

method.name: :find2
method.description: Returns :mini:`(Index, Needle)` where :mini:`Index` is the first occurence of :mini:`Needle` in :mini:`Haystack`, or :mini:`nil` if no occurence is found.

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":find2("cat") :> (5, cat) "The cat snored as he slept":find2("dog") :> nil

method.name: :find2
method.description: Returns :mini:`(Index, Needle)` where :mini:`Index` is the first occurence of :mini:`Needle` in :mini:`Haystack` at or after :mini:`Start`, or :mini:`nil` if no occurence is found.

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":find2("s", 1) :> (9, s) "The cat snored as he slept":find2("s", 10) :> (17, s) "The cat snored as he slept":find2("s", -6) :> (22, s)

method.name: :find2

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":find2(r"[a-z]{3}") :> (5, cat) "The cat snored as he slept":find2(r"[0-9]+") :> nil

method.name: :find2

example.code: "The cat snored as he slept":find2(r"s[a-z]+", 1) :> (9, snored) "The cat snored as he slept":find2(r"s[a-z]+", 10) :> (22, slept) "The cat snored as he slept":find2(r"s[a-z]+", -6) :> (22, slept)

Functions are called with the matched string or regex subpatterns.

method.description: Returns a copy of :mini:`String` with each occurence of :mini:`Pattern` replaced by :mini:`Fn(Match, Sub₁, ..., Subₙ)` where :mini:`Match` is the actual matched text and :mini:`Subᵢ` are the matched subpatterns.

example.code: "the cat snored as he slept":replace(r" ([a-z])", fun(Match, A) '-{A:upper}') :> "the-Cat-Snored-As-He-Slept"

method.name: :replace
method.description: Returns a copy of :mini:`String` with the :mini:`String[I]` is replaced by :mini:`Replacement`.

method.name: :replace

method.name: :replace
method.description: Returns a copy of :mini:`String` with the :mini:`String[I, J]` is replaced by :mini:`Replacement`.

example.code: "Hello world":replace(1, 6, "Goodbye") :> "Goodbye world" "Hello world":replace(-6, 0, ", how are you?") :> "Hello, how are you?"

Returns a copy of :mini:`String` with each matching string or regex from :mini:`Replacements` replaced with the corresponding value. Functions are called with the matched string or regex subpatterns.

function.name: string::escape

function.name: string::switch
function.description: Implements :mini:`switch` for string values. Case values must be strings or regular expressions.

example.code:
for Pet in ["cat", "dog", "mouse", "fox"] do switch Pet: string case "cat" do print("Meow!
") case "dog" do print("Woof!
") case "mouse" do print("Squeak!
") else print("???!") end end :> error("MethodError", "no method found for write(xml::element, string)")

Minilang currently uses signed 64-bit integers so this method will produce incorrect results if the actual value is too large to fit. This may change in future implementations or if arbitrary precision integers are added to the runtime.

method.description: Returns the remainder of :mini:`Stream` or :mini:`nil` if :mini:`Stream` is empty.

method.description: Sets the position for the next read or write in :mini:`Stream` to :mini:`Offset` using :mini:`Mode`. This method should be overridden for streams defined in Minilang.

method.name: :tell
method.description: Gets the position for the next read or write in :mini:`Stream`. This method should be overridden for streams defined in Minilang.

method.name: :write
method.description: Writes the bytes at :mini:`Address` to :mini:`Stream`. This method should be overridden for streams defined in Minilang.

method.name: :write
method.description: Writes from :mini:`Source` to :mini:`Stream` returning the actual number of bytes written.

method.name: :write
method.description: Writes each :mini:`Valueᵢ` in turn to :mini:`Stream`.

type.name: stream::buffered
type.description: A stream that buffers reads and writes from another stream.

type.name: stream
type.description: Base type of readable and writable byte streams.

constructor.name: stream::buffered
constructor.description: Returns a new stream that buffers reads and writes from :mini:`Stream`.

method.description: Returns a new set containing the values of :mini:`Set₁` which are also in :mini:`Set₂`.
Returns a new set combining the values of :mini:`Set₁` and :mini:`Set₂`.
Returns a new set containing the values of :mini:`Set₁` which are not in :mini:`Set₂`.
Returns a new set containing the values of :mini:`Set₁` which are also in :mini:`Set₂`.

method.name: :append
method.description: Appends the values of :mini:`Set` to :mini:`Buffer` with :mini:`Sep` between values.

method.name: :append
method.description: Appends a representation of :mini:`Set` to :mini:`Buffer`.

method.name: :const
method.description: Returns a new set contains copies of the elements of :mini:`Set` created using :mini:`Visitor`.

method.name: :copy
method.description: Returns a new set contains copies of the elements of :mini:`Set` created using :mini:`Copy`.

method.name: :count
method.description: Returns the number of values in :mini:`Set`.

method.name: :delete
method.description: Removes :mini:`Value` from :mini:`Set` and returns it if found, otherwise :mini:`nil`.

method.name: :empty
method.description: Deletes all values from :mini:`Set` and returns it.

example.code: let S := set(["A", "B", "C"]) :> {A, B, C} S:empty :> {}

method.name: :first
method.description: Returns the first value in :mini:`Set` or :mini:`nil` if :mini:`Set` is empty.

method.name: :from
method.description: Returns the subset of :mini:`Set` after :mini:`Value` as a sequence.

method.name: :grow
method.description: Adds of all the values produced by :mini:`Sequence` to :mini:`Set` and returns :mini:`Set`.

example.code: set("cake"):grow("banana") :> {c, a, k, e, b, n}

method.name: :in
method.description: Returns :mini:`Key` if it is in :mini:`Map`, otherwise return :mini:`nil`.

method.name: :insert
method.description: Inserts :mini:`Value` into :mini:`Set`. Returns the previous value associated with :mini:`Key` if any, otherwise :mini:`nil`.

method.name: :last
method.description: Returns the last value in :mini:`Set` or :mini:`nil` if :mini:`Set` is empty.

method.name: :missing
method.description: If :mini:`Value` is present in :mini:`Set` then returns :mini:`nil`. Otherwise inserts :mini:`Value` into :mini:`Set` and returns :mini:`some`.

method.name: :order
method.description: Sets the ordering

method.name: :order
method.description: Returns the current ordering of :mini:`Set`.

method.name: :pop
method.description: Deletes the first value from :mini:`Set` according to its iteration order. Returns the deleted value, or :mini:`nil` if :mini:`Set` is empty.

method.name: :precount
method.description: Returns the number of values in :mini:`Set`.

method.name: :pull
method.description: Deletes the last value from :mini:`Set` according to its iteration order. Returns the deleted value, or :mini:`nil` if :mini:`Set` is empty.

method.name: :push
method.description: Inserts each :mini:`Value` into :mini:`Set` at the start.

method.name: :put
method.description: Inserts each :mini:`Value` into :mini:`Set` at the end.

method.name: :random
method.description: Returns a random (assignable) node from :mini:`Set`.

method.name: :reverse
method.description: Reverses the iteration order of :mini:`Set` in-place and returns it.

example.code: let S := set("cake") :> {c, a, k, e} S:reverse :> {e, k, a, c}

method.name: :size
method.description: Returns the number of values in :mini:`Set`.

method.name: :sort
method.description: Sorts the values (changes the iteration order) of :mini:`Set` using :mini:`Valueᵢ < Valueⱼ` and returns :mini:`Set`.

example.code: let S := set("cake") :> {c, a, k, e} S:sort :> {a, c, e, k}

method.name: :sort
method.description: Sorts the values (changes the iteration order) of :mini:`Set` using :mini:`Cmp(Valueᵢ, Valueⱼ)` and returns :mini:`Set`

example.code: let S := set("cake") :> {c, a, k, e} S:sort(>) :> {k, e, c, a}

method.name: :visit
method.description: Returns a new set contains copies of the elements of :mini:`Set` created using :mini:`Copy`.
Returns a tuple of :mini:`(Set₁ / Set₂, Set₁ * Set₂, Set₂ / Set₁)`.
Returns a new set containing the values of :mini:`Set₁` and :mini:`Set₂` that are not in both.

type.name: set::order
type.description: * :mini:`set::order::Insert` |harr| default ordering; inserted values are put at end, no reordering on access. * :mini:`set::order::Ascending` |harr| inserted values are kept in ascending order, no reordering on access. * :mini:`set::order::Descending` |harr| inserted values are kept in descending order, no reordering on access. * :mini:`set::order::MRU` |harr| inserted values are put at start, accessed values are moved to start. * :mini:`set::order::LRU` |harr| inserted values are put at end, accessed values are moved to end.

type.name: set
type.description: A set of values. Values can be of any type supporting hashing and comparison. By default, iterating over a set generates the values in the order they were inserted, however this ordering can be changed.

method.description: Returns :mini:`Value` if it is in :mini:`Set`, otherwise returns :mini:`nil`..
Returns a new set combining the values of :mini:`Set₁` and :mini:`Set₂`.

constructor.name: set
constructor.description: Returns a new set.

constructor.name: set
constructor.description: Returns a set of all the values produced by :mini:`Sequence`.

type.name: context
type.description: A context key can be used to create context specific values. If :mini:`key` is a context key, then calling :mini:`key()` no arguments returns the value associated with the key in the current context, or :mini:`nil` is no value is associated. Calling :mini:`key(Value, Function)` will invoke :mini:`Function` in a new context where :mini:`key` is associated with :mini:`Value`.

constructor.name: context
constructor.description: Creates a new context specific key.

type.name: uninitialized
type.description: An uninitialized value. Used for forward declarations.

function.name: atomic
function.description: Calls :mini:`Fn(Args)` in a new context without a scheduler and returns the result.

function.name: break
function.description: If a debugger is present and :mini:`Condition` is omitted or not :mini:`nil` then triggers a breakpoint.

function.name: trace
function.description: Returns the call stack trace (source locations).

method.name: :message
method.description: Returns the message of :mini:`Error`.

method.name: :raise
method.description: Returns :mini:`Error` as an error (i.e. rethrows the error).

method.name: :trace
method.description: Returns the stack trace of :mini:`Error` as a list of tuples.

method.name: :type
method.description: Returns the type of :mini:`Error`.

type.name: error
type.description: An error. Values of this type are not accessible from Minilang code since they are caught by the runtime. Each error contains an *error value* which contains the details of the error.

type.name: error::value
type.description: An error value. Error values contain the details of an error but are not themselves errors (since errors are caught by the runtime).

constructor.name: error
constructor.description: Creates an error exception with type :mini:`Type` and message :mini:`Message`. Since this creates an exception, it will trigger the current exception handler.

function.name: raise
function.description: Creates a general exception with type :mini:`Type` and value :mini:`Value`. Since this creates an exception, it will trigger the current exception handler.

method.name: :breakpoint_clear
method.description: Clears any breakpoints from :mini:`Source` at line :mini:`Line`.

method.name: :breakpoint_set
method.description: Sets a breakpoint in :mini:`Source` at line :mini:`Line`.

method.name: :continue
method.description: Resume :mini:`State` with :mini:`Value` in the debugger.

method.name: :error_mode
method.description: If :mini:`Set` is not :mini:`nil` then :mini:`Debugger` will stop on errors.

method.name: :locals
method.description: Returns the list of locals in :mini:`State`. Returns an empty list if :mini:`State` does not have any debugging information.

method.name: :source
method.description: Returns the source location for :mini:`State`.

method.name: :step_in
method.description: Resume :mini:`State` with :mini:`Value` in the debugger, stopping after the next line.

method.name: :step_mode
method.description: If :mini:`Set` is not :mini:`nil` then :mini:`Debugger` will stop on after each line.

method.name: :step_out
method.description: Resume :mini:`State` with :mini:`Value` in the debugger, stopping at the end of the current function.

method.name: :step_over
method.description: Resume :mini:`State` with :mini:`Value` in the debugger, stopping after the next line in the same function (i.e. stepping over function calls).

method.name: :trace
method.description: Returns the call trace from :mini:`State`, excluding states that do not have debugging information.

constructor.name: debugger
constructor.description: Returns a new debugger for :mini:`Function()`.

method.name: :signal
method.description: Increments the internal value in :mini:`Semaphore`, resuming any waiters. Returns the new value.

method.name: :value
method.description: Returns the internal value in :mini:`Semaphore`.

method.name: :wait
method.description: Waits until the internal value in :mini:`Semaphore` is postive, then decrements it and returns the new value.

type.name: semaphore
type.description: A semaphore for synchronizing concurrent code.

constructor.name: semaphore
constructor.description: Returns a new semaphore with initial value :mini:`Initial` or :mini:`1` if no initial value is specified.

method.name: :broadcast
method.description: Signals :mini:`Condition`, resuming all waiters.

method.name: :signal
method.description: Signals :mini:`Condition`, resuming a single waiter.

method.name: :wait
method.description: Increments :mini:`Semaphore`, waits until :mini:`Condition` is signalled, then decrements :mini:`Semaphore` (waiting if necessary) and returns its value.

type.name: condition
type.description: A condition for synchronizing concurrent code.

constructor.name: condition

method.name: :rdlock
method.description: Locks :mini:`Lock` for reading, waiting if there are any writers using or waiting to use :mini:`Lock`.

method.name: :unlock
method.description: Unlocks :mini:`Lock`, resuming any waiting writers or readers (giving preference to writers).

method.name: :wrlock
method.description: Locks :mini:`Lock` for reading, waiting if there are any readers or other writers using :mini:`Lock`.

type.name: rwlock
type.description: A read-write lock for synchronizing concurrent code.

constructor.name: rwlock
constructor.description: Returns a new read-write lock.

method.name: :adjust
method.description: Changes the priority of :mini:`Entry` to :mini:`Priority`.

method.name: :count
method.description: Returns the number of entries in :mini:`Queue`.

method.name: :insert
method.description: Creates and returns a new entry in :mini:`Queue` with value :mini:`Value` and priority :mini:`Priority`.

method.name: :lower
method.description: Changes the priority of :mini:`Entry` to :mini:`Priority` only if its current priority is greater than :mini:`Priority`.

method.name: :next
method.description: Removes and returns the highest priority entry in :mini:`Queue`, or :mini:`nil` if :mini:`Queue` is empty.

method.name: :peek
method.description: Returns the highest priority entry in :mini:`Queue` without removing it, or :mini:`nil` if :mini:`Queue` is empty.

method.name: :priority
method.description: Returns the priority associated with :mini:`Entry`.

method.name: :queued
method.description: Returns :mini:`Entry` if it is currently in the priority queue, otherwise returns :mini:`nil`.

method.name: :raise
method.description: Changes the priority of :mini:`Entry` to :mini:`Priority` only if its current priority is less than :mini:`Priority`.

method.name: :remove
method.description: Removes :mini:`Entry` from its priority queue.

method.name: :requeue
method.description: Adds :mini:`Entry` back into its priority queue if it is not currently in the queue.

method.name: :value
method.description: Returns the value associated with :mini:`Entry`.

type.name: pqueue::entry

type.name: pqueue

constructor.name: pqueue

constructor.name: polynomial
constructor.description: Returns the polynomial corresponding to the variable :mini:`Var`.

example.code: let X := polynomial("x"), Y := polynomial("y") :> y let P := (X - Y) ^ 4 :> x⁴ - 4x³y + 6x²y² - 4xy³ + y⁴ P(y is 3) :> x⁴ - 12x³ + 54x² - 108x + 81

function.name: polynomial::roots
function.description: Returns the roots of the single variable polynomial :math:`Coeff_{0} + Coeff_{1}x + Coeff_{2}x^{2} + ...`. If the degree is less than 5, the relevant formula is used to calculate the roots, otherwise the roots are estimated using an iterative process.

method.description: Retrieves the field :mini:`Field` from :mini:`Object`. Mainly intended for unpacking objects.

type.description: Parent type of all object classes.

type.description: A value with an associated setter function.

constructor.name: class
constructor.description: Returns a new class inheriting from :mini:`Parents`, with fields :mini:`Fields` and exports :mini:`Exports`. The special exports :mini:`::of` and :mini:`::init` can be set to override the default conversion and initialization behaviour. The :mini:`::new` export will *always* be set to the original constructor for this class.

constructor.name: property
constructor.description: Returns a new property which dereferences to :mini:`Value`. Assigning to the property will call :mini:`Set(NewValue)`.

method.description: Returns a range of enum values. :mini:`Min` and :mini:`Max` must belong to the same enumeration.

method.name: :count
method.description: Returns the size of the enumeration :mini:`Enum`.

type.name: enum
type.description: The base type of enumeration types.

constructor.name: enum
constructor.description: Returns a new enumeration type.

example.code: let colour := enum(Red is 10, Green is 20, Blue is 30) :> <<colour>> colour::Red :> Red list(colour, _ + 0) :> [10, 20, 30]

constructor.name: enum
constructor.description: Returns a new enumeration type.

example.code: let day := enum("Mon", "Tue", "Wed", "Thu", "Fri", "Sat", "Sun") :> <<day>> day::Wed :> Wed day::Fri + 0 :> 5

type.name: enum::value
type.description: An instance of an enumeration type.

method.description: Returns the union of :mini:`Flags₁` and :mini:`Flags₂`. :mini:`Flags₁` and :mini:`Flags₂` must have the same flags type.

example.code: let mode := flags("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> <<mode>> mode::Read + mode::Write :> Write,Read

method.description: Returns the difference of :mini:`Flags₁` and :mini:`Flags₂`. :mini:`Flags₁` and :mini:`Flags₂` must have the same flags type.

example.code: let mode := flags("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> <<mode>> mode("Read", "Write") - mode::Write :> Read

method.description: Returns the :mini:`Flags₂` if it contains all of :mini:`Flags₁`. :mini:`Flags₁` and :mini:`Flags₂` must have the same flags type.

example.code: let mode := flags("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> <<mode>> mode("Read", "Write") < mode("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> Write,Read,Execute mode("Read", "Write", "Execute") < mode("Read", "Write") :> nil

method.description: Returns the :mini:`Flags₂` if it contains all of :mini:`Flags₁`. :mini:`Flags₁` and :mini:`Flags₂` must have the same flags type.

example.code: let mode := flags("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> <<mode>> mode("Read", "Write") <= mode("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> Write,Read,Execute mode("Read", "Write", "Execute") <= mode("Read", "Write") :> nil

method.description: Returns the :mini:`Flags₂` if it is contained in :mini:`Flags₁`. :mini:`Flags₁` and :mini:`Flags₂` must have the same flags type.

example.code: let mode := flags("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> <<mode>> mode("Read", "Write") > mode("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> nil mode("Read", "Write", "Execute") > mode("Read", "Write") :> Write,Read

method.description: Returns the :mini:`Flags₂` if it is contained in :mini:`Flags₁`. :mini:`Flags₁` and :mini:`Flags₂` must have the same flags type.

example.code: let mode := flags("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> <<mode>> mode("Read", "Write") >= mode("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> nil mode("Read", "Write", "Execute") >= mode("Read", "Write") :> Write,Read

type.name: flags
type.description: The base type of flag types.

constructor.name: flags
constructor.description: Returns a new flags type, where :mini:`Nameᵢ` has value :math:`2^{i-1}`.

example.code: let mode := flags("Read", "Write", "Execute") :> <<mode>> mode::Read :> Read mode::Read + mode::Write :> Write,Read

constructor.name: flags
constructor.description: Returns a new flags type Returns a new flags type, where :mini:`Nameᵢ` has value :mini:`Valueᵢ`.

example.code: let mode := flags(Read is 1, Write is 4, Execute is 32) :> <<mode>> mode::Read :> Read mode::Read + mode::Write :> Write,Read

type.name: flags::spec

category.name: minijs
category.description:
Provides a specialized encoding of Minilang values to and from JSON with support for complex or cyclic data structures.
* :json:`null` |harr| :mini:`nil` * :json:`true` |harr| :mini:`true` * :json:`false` |harr| :mini:`false` * *integer* |harr| :mini:`integer` * *real* |harr| :mini:`real` * *string* |harr| :mini:`string` * ``[type, ...]`` |harr| *other*

method.name: :MLMethodDefine
method.description: Adds a new type signature and associated function to :mini:`Method`. If the last argument is :mini:`..` then the signature is variadic. Method definitions using :mini:`meth` are translated into calls to :mini:`method::set`.

method.name: :MLMethodDefine
method.description: Adds a new type signature and associated function to :mini:`Method`. If the last argument is :mini:`..` then the signature is variadic. Method definitions using :mini:`meth` are translated into calls to :mini:`method::set`.

method.name: :name
method.description: Returns the name of :mini:`Method`.

type.name: method::context
type.description:
A context for isolating method definitions.
:mini:`(C: method::context)(Args: any, ..., Fn: function): any` Calls :mini:`Fn(Args)` in a new context using :mini:`C` for method definitions.

type.name: method
type.description:
A map of type signatures to functions. Each type signature consists of a number of types and a flag denoting whether the signature is variadic.
:mini:`(M: method)(Arg₁, ..., Argₙ)` Calls :mini:`Fn(Arg₁, ..., Argₙ)` where :mini:`Fn` is the function associated with the closest matching type signature defined in :mini:`M`.
A type signature :mini:`(Type₁, ..., Type/k, Variadic)` matches if :mini:`type(Argᵢ) < Typeᵢ` for each :math:`i = 1, ..., k` and either :math:`n = k` or :math:`n < k` and :math:`Variadic` is true.
* A type signature is considered a closer match if its types are closer in terms of subtyping to the types of the arguments. * A type signature with the same number of types as arguments is considered a closer match than a matching variadic signature with fewer types.

type.name: map::order
type.description: * :mini:`map::order::Insert` |harr| default ordering; inserted pairs are put at end, no reordering on access. * :mini:`map::order::Ascending` |harr| inserted pairs are kept in ascending key order, no reordering on access. * :mini:`map::order::Descending` |harr| inserted pairs are kept in descending key order, no reordering on access. * :mini:`map::order::MRU` |harr| inserted pairs are put at start, accessed pairs are moved to start. * :mini:`map::order::LRU` |harr| inserted pairs are put at end, accessed pairs are moved to end.

type.name: map

method.description:
Returns :mini:`A != B` (element-wise). The shapes of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B` must be compatible, i.e. either
* :mini:`A:shape = B:shape` or * :mini:`B:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`A:shape`.
When the shapes are not the same, remaining dimensions are repeated (broadcast) to the required size.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := if Aᵥ != B then 1 else 0 end`.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := if A != Bᵥ then 1 else 0 end`.

Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := if A != Bᵥ then 1 else 0 end`.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := if Aᵥ != B then 1 else 0 end`.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := if A != Bᵥ then 1 else 0 end`.
Returns an array with the contents of :mini:`List`.

Returns :mini:`A * B` (element-wise). The shapes of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B` must be compatible, i.e. either
* :mini:`A:shape = B:shape` or * :mini:`A:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`B:shape` or * :mini:`B:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`A:shape`.
When the shapes are not the same, remaining dimensions are repeated (broadcast) to the required size.

example.code: let A := array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]) :> let B := array([[7, 8, 9], [10, 11, 12]]) :> let C := array([5, 10, 15]) :> A * B :> B * A :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") A * C :> C * A :> B * C :> C * B :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared")

method.description: Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := Aᵥ * B`.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := A * Bᵥ`.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := Aᵥ * B`.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := A * Bᵥ`.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := Aᵥ * B`.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := A * Bᵥ`.
Returns an array with :mini:`Aᵢ * Bⱼ` for each pair of elements of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B`. The result will have shape :mini:`A:shape + B:shape`.

example.code: let A := array([1, 8, 3]) :> let B := array([[7, 2], [4, 11]]) :> A:shape :> [3] B:shape :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") let C := A ** B :> C:shape :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier C not declared")

method.description: Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := Aᵥ + B`.

Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := A + Bᵥ`.

Returns :mini:`A + B` (element-wise). The shapes of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B` must be compatible, i.e. either
* :mini:`A:shape = B:shape` or * :mini:`A:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`B:shape` or * :mini:`B:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`A:shape`.
When the shapes are not the same, remaining dimensions are repeated (broadcast) to the required size.

example.code: let A := array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]) :> let B := array([[7, 8, 9], [10, 11, 12]]) :> let C := array([5, 10, 15]) :> A + B :> B + A :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") A + C :> C + A :> B + C :> C + B :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared")

method.description: Returns an array with :mini:`Aᵢ + Bⱼ` for each pair of elements of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B`. The result will have shape :mini:`A:shape + B:shape`.

example.code: let A := array([1, 8, 3]) :> let B := array([[7, 2], [4, 11]]) :> A:shape :> [3] B:shape :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") let C := A ++ B :> C:shape :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier C not declared")

method.description:
Returns :mini:`A - B` (element-wise). The shapes of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B` must be compatible, i.e. either
* :mini:`A:shape = B:shape` or * :mini:`A:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`B:shape` or * :mini:`B:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`A:shape`.
When the shapes are not the same, remaining dimensions are repeated (broadcast) to the required size.

example.code: let A := array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]) :> let B := array([[7, 8, 9], [10, 11, 12]]) :> let C := array([5, 10, 15]) :> A - B :> B - A :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") A - C :> C - A :> B - C :> C - B :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared")

example.code: let A := array([1, 8, 3]) :> let B := array([[7, 2], [4, 11]]) :> A:shape :> [3] B:shape :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") let C := A -- B :> C:shape :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier C not declared")

When the shapes are not the same, remaining dimensions are repeated (broadcast) to the required size.

example.code: let A := array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]) :> let B := array([[7, 8, 9], [10, 11, 12]]) :> let C := array([5, 10, 15]) :> A / B :> B / A :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") A / C :> C / A :> B / C :> C / B :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared")

example.code: let A := array([1, 8, 3]) :> let B := array([[7, 2], [4, 11]]) :> A:shape :> [3] B:shape :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") let C := A // B :> C:shape :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier C not declared")

method.description:
Returns :mini:`A /\ B` (element-wise). The shapes of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B` must be compatible, i.e. either
* :mini:`A:shape = B:shape` or * :mini:`A:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`B:shape` or * :mini:`B:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`A:shape`.
When the shapes are not the same, remaining dimensions are repeated (broadcast) to the required size.

example.code: let A := array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]) :> let B := array([[7, 8, 9], [10, 11, 12]]) :> let C := array([5, 10, 15]) :> A /\ B :> B /\ A :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") A /\ C :> C /\ A :> B /\ C :> C /\ B :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared")

method.name: :copy
method.description: Return a new array with the results of applying :mini:`Function` to each value of :mini:`Array`.

method.name: :copy
method.description: Return a new array with the same values of :mini:`Array` but not sharing the underlying data.

method.name: :count
method.description: Return the number of elements in :mini:`Array`.

method.name: :degree
method.description: Return the degree of :mini:`Array`.

method.name: :det
method.description: Returns the determinant of :mini:`A`.

method.name: :expand
method.description: Returns an array sharing the underlying data with :mini:`Array` with additional unit-length axes at the specified :mini:`Indices`.

method.name: :join
method.description: Returns an array sharing the underlying data with :mini:`Array` replacing the dimensions at :mini:`Start .. (Start + Count)` with a single dimension with the same overall size.

method.name: :max
method.description:
Returns :mini:`A max B` (element-wise). The shapes of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B` must be compatible, i.e. either
* :mini:`A:shape = B:shape` or * :mini:`A:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`B:shape` or * :mini:`B:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`A:shape`.
When the shapes are not the same, remaining dimensions are repeated (broadcast) to the required size.

example.code: let A := array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]) :> let B := array([[7, 8, 9], [10, 11, 12]]) :> let C := array([5, 10, 15]) :> A max B :> B max A :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") A max C :> C max A :> B max C :> C max B :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared")

method.description: Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := max(Aᵥ, B)`.

method.description: Returns a new array with the maximums of :mini:`Array` in the last :mini:`Count` dimensions.

method.name: :min
method.description:
Returns :mini:`A min B` (element-wise). The shapes of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B` must be compatible, i.e. either
* :mini:`A:shape = B:shape` or * :mini:`A:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`B:shape` or * :mini:`B:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`A:shape`.
When the shapes are not the same, remaining dimensions are repeated (broadcast) to the required size.

example.code: let A := array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]) :> let B := array([[7, 8, 9], [10, 11, 12]]) :> let C := array([5, 10, 15]) :> A min B :> B min A :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") A min C :> C min A :> B min C :> C min B :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared")

method.name: :prod
method.description: Returns the product of the values in :mini:`Array`.

method.name: :prod
method.description: Returns a new array with the products of :mini:`Array` in the last :mini:`Count` dimensions.

method.name: :prods
method.description: Returns a new array with the partial products of :mini:`Array` in the :mini:`Index`-th dimension.

method.name: :reshape
method.description:
Returns a copy of :mini:`Array` with dimensions specified by :mini:`Sizes`. .. note::
This method always makes a copy of the data so that changes to the returned array do not affect the original.

method.name: :shape
method.description: Return the shape of :mini:`Array`.

method.name: :softmax
method.description: Returns :mini:`softmax(Vector)`.

method.name: :split
method.description: Returns an array sharing the underlying data with :mini:`Array` replacing the dimension at :mini:`Index` with new dimensions with sizes :mini:`Sizes`. The total count :mini:`Sizes₁ * Sizes₂ * ... * Sizesₙ` must equal the original size.

method.name: :strides
method.description: Return the strides of :mini:`Array` in bytes.

method.name: :sum
method.description: Returns the sum of the values in :mini:`Array`.

method.name: :sum
method.description: Returns a new array with the sums of :mini:`Array` in the last :mini:`Count` dimensions.

method.name: :sums
method.description: Returns a new array with the partial sums of :mini:`Array` in the :mini:`Index`-th dimension.

method.name: :swap
method.description: Returns the transpose of :mini:`Array`, sharing the underlying data.

method.name: :swap
method.description: Returns an array sharing the underlying data with :mini:`Array` with dimensions :mini:`Index₁` and :mini:`Index₂` swapped.

method.name: :tr
method.description: Returns the trace of :mini:`A`.

method.name: :update
method.description: Update the values in :mini:`Array` in place by applying :mini:`Function` to each value.

method.name: :where
method.description: Returns list of indices :mini:`Array` where :mini:`Function(Arrayᵢ)` returns a non-nil value.

method.name: :where
method.description: Returns a list of non-zero indices of :mini:`Array`.

method.description:
Returns a sub-array of :mini:`Array` sharing the underlying data, indexed by :mini:`Indexᵢ`. Dimensions are copied to the output array, applying the indices as follows:
* If :mini:`Indexᵢ` is :mini:`nil` or :mini:`*` then the next dimension is copied unchanged.
* If :mini:`Indexᵢ` is :mini:`..` then the remaining indices are applied to the last dimensions of :mini:`Array` and the dimensions in between are copied unchanged.
* If :mini:`Indexᵢ` is an :mini:`integer` then the :mini:`Indexᵢ`-th value of the next dimension is selected and the dimension is dropped from the output.
* If :mini:`Indexᵢ` is an :mini:`integer::range` then the corresponding slice of the next dimension is copied to the output.
* If :mini:`Indexᵢ` is a :mini:`tuple[integer, ...]` then the next dimensions are indexed by the corresponding integer in turn (i.e. :mini:`A[(I, J, K)]` gives the same result as :mini:`A[I, J, K]`).
* If :mini:`Indexᵢ` is a :mini:`list[integer]` then the next dimension is copied as a sparse dimension with the respective entries.
* If :mini:`Indexᵢ` is a :mini:`list[tuple[integer, ...]]` then the appropriate dimensions are dropped and a single sparse dimension is added with the corresponding entries.
* If :mini:`Indexᵢ` is an :mini:`array::int8` with dimensions matching the corresponding dimensions of :mini:`A` then a sparse dimension is added with entries corresponding to the non-zero values in :mini:`Indexᵢ` (i.e. :mini:`A[B]` is equivalent to :mini:`A[B:where]`). * If :mini:`Indexᵢ` is an :mini:`array::int32` with all but last dimensions matching the corresponding dimensions of :mini:`A` then a sparse dimension is added with entries corresponding indices in the last dimension of :mini:`Indexᵢ`.
If fewer than :mini:`A:degree` indices are provided then the remaining dimensions are copied unchanged.
Returns a sub-array of :mini:`Array` sharing the underlying data. The :mini:`i`-th dimension is indexed by :mini:`Indices[i]` if present, and :mini:`nil` otherwise.
Returns the inverse of :mini:`A`.
Returns the solution :mini:`X` of :mini:`A . X = B`.
Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := A bitwise or Bᵥ`.

Returns :mini:`A \/ B` (element-wise). The shapes of :mini:`A` and :mini:`B` must be compatible, i.e. either
* :mini:`A:shape = B:shape` or * :mini:`A:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`B:shape` or * :mini:`B:shape` is a prefix of :mini:`A:shape`.
When the shapes are not the same, remaining dimensions are repeated (broadcast) to the required size.

example.code: let A := array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]) :> let B := array([[7, 8, 9], [10, 11, 12]]) :> let C := array([5, 10, 15]) :> A \/ B :> B \/ A :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") A \/ C :> C \/ A :> B \/ C :> C \/ B :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared")

method.description: Returns an array :mini:`C` where each :mini:`Cᵥ := Aᵥ bitwise or B`.
Returns an array with the contents of :mini:`List`, transposed.
Returns the transpose of :mini:`Array`, sharing the underlying data.

constructor.name: array
constructor.description: Returns a new array containing the values in :mini:`List`. The shape and type of the array is determined from the elements in :mini:`List`.

constructor.name: array::any
constructor.description: Returns a new array of any values with the specified dimensions.

function.name: array::cat
function.description: Returns a new array with the values of :mini:`Array₁, ..., Arrayₙ` concatenated along the :mini:`Index`-th dimension.

example.code: let A := $[[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]] :> let B := $[[7, 8, 9], [10, 11, 12]] :> array::cat(1, A, B) :> error("CompilerError", "Identifier B not declared") array::cat(2, A, B) :>

function.name: array::hcat
